intro: Beauverdia uniflora f. roseoplena, commonly known as the rose-pink everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white ray florets surrounded by yellow disk florets, which contribute to its ornamental value. It is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its drought tolerance. The foliage is narrow and grass-like, with the plant often growing in dense, mat-forming clusters.
